page.title: 15WOLBOROUGH & ABBOTSKERSWELL
page.content: The area is mainly agricultural.{ {Wolborough Barton Farm}owns 181 acres and the rest is owned by{Manor Farm.} On the former corn,wheat,barley and 11 acres of peas are grown.Dairy cows and beef cattle are reared. The farm has elaborate machinery.{Manor Farm}has 110 cattle and 100 sheep. The highest point of 320 metres gives a dazzling view. About a third of the area is urban and the rest is rural, there is an old 2 acre quarry. The West End nurseries send shrubs and conifers to customers throughout the country.In{ {Abbotskerswell}houses are older, some having been built in the{14th century. Now many modern houses are being developed. In Wolborough also most are old, some supposed to be 12th century. The area has an estimated population of 1750. Industry includes{Watermota, making marine engines &{G.M.P.T.
